page.title: 04SHEEP FARMING
page.content: This area includes;Higher Windy Way dog kennels are set in 30 acres of land.The owners of Windy Way House raise ducks and sell their eggs,they also sell rhubarb.The Methodist church of Walker Barn has 1 Sunday service at 6.30 pm.The Chapel Cottage has a car park for The Setter Dog which deals with car trade and offers drinks and meals and includes a picnic area.In the hills is a disused sand stone quarry and the fields nearby are used for sheep and cattle.At Teggs Nose is a bus route from Chester station to Mansfield station.Lower Windy Way Farm,built around 1800.At the moment the farm has 45 acres rearing cows and sheep and the owners visit Chelford Market weekly.Their machinery includes a tractor but there are no commercial crops.
